alert.note: Alert for Edgefield; McCormick (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 22 at 7:25PM EST until January 23 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Columbia SC has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in South Carolina... Stevens Creek Near Modoc affecting McCormick and Edgefield Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT TO EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Stevens Creek Near Modoc. * WHEN...From late tonight to early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 19.0 feet, Farmland along Stevens Creek above the US Highway 23 bridge near Modoc becomes flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 PM EST Sunday the stage was 18.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage jaround 9 pm tonight the to a crest of 19.2 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 19.0 feet. - http://www.floodsafety.noaa.gov &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and take action if necessary. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Monday morning at 730 AM EST.
